intro: Rosa pimpinelloides, commonly known as the Alpine rose or mountain rose, is a species of flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters, with woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white to pink, usually blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in a fine layer of white, fuzzy hairs. Rosa pimpinelloides is well adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in mountainous areas with poor soil.
